benefits.title: Silymarin in non-cirrhotics with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis: A randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled trial
benefits.summary: Silymarin, an extract of milk thistle, is commonly used to treat chronic liver disease and may be a treatment for NASH due to its antioxidant properties.

benefits.title: Providing the plant extract silymarin to lactating sows: effects on litter performance and oxidative stress in sows.
benefits.summary: Silymarin providing up to 8g/day to lactating sows had no beneficial effects on circulating prolactin concentrations, oxidative status, or performance of sows and their litters.
benefits.journal: Animal : an international journal of animal bioscience

benefits.title: Silymarin BIO-C, an extract from Silybum marianum fruits, induces hyperprolactinemia in intact female rats.
benefits.summary: Silymarin BIO-C, an extract from Silybum marianum fruits, increases circulating prolactin levels in female rats, potentially stimulating milk production.
benefits.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

benefits.title: Milk thistle and chronic liver disease
benefits.summary: Silymarin, the active ingredient in milk thistle, has hepatoprotective effects and can protect experimental animals against injury from toxins.

benefits.title: The effect of milk thistle (Silybum marianum) and its main flavonolignans on CYP2C8 enzyme activity in human liver microsomes.
benefits.summary: Silymarin, the primary extract of milk thistle, inhibits CYP2C8 enzyme activity in vitro.

benefits.title: Silymarin improved diet-induced liver damage and insulin resistance by decreasing inflammation in mice
benefits.summary: Silymarin improves diet-induced liver damage and insulin resistance by decreasing inflammation in mice.

benefits.title: A review of therapeutic potentials of milk thistle (Silybum marianum L.) and its main constituent, silymarin, on cancer, and their related patents
benefits.summary: Silymarin, a flavonolignan extract of milk thistle, demonstrates chemopreventive effects against cancers and could be beneficial to oncology patients, especially for treating side effects of anticancer chemotherapeutics.
benefits.journal: Iranian Journal of Basic Medical Sciences

benefits.title: Silymarin is an ally against insulin resistance: a review.
benefits.summary: Silymarin, a component of Milk thistle, has been shown to have insulin-sensitizing properties, potentially benefiting those with insulin resistance.

benefits.title: Is silymarin hepatoprotective in alcoholic liver disease?
benefits.summary: Silymarin, the main active complex in milk thistle, has potential therapeutic benefits in liver necroinflammation and fibrogenesis, and may have potential therapeutic value in alcohol liver disease.

benefits.title: The use of alternative medicine in the treatment of hepatitis C.
benefits.summary: Silymarin, extracted from milk thistle, is widely used as a remedy for liver diseases, with beneficial effects seen in patients with cirrhosis due to alcohol abuse.

side effects.title: Presence of Mycotoxins in Milk Thistle (Silybum marianum) Food Supplements: A Review
side effects.summary: Milk thistle (Silymarin) can be contaminated by mycotoxins, which can reduce or antagonize the beneficial effects of silymarin on liver diseases.

side effects.title: Milk thistle
side effects.summary: Mild gastrointestinal distress and allergic reactions are rare side effects of milk thistle, and serious toxicity rarely has been reported.

side effects.title: Milk Thistle ( Silybum marianum L. Gaert.) Seeds in Health
side effects.summary: Milk thistle seeds are safe, well tolerated, and cause no serious side effects in humans, but may cause mild gastrointestinal and allergic reactions.
side effects.journal: Nuts and Seeds in Health and Disease Prevention

side effects.title: The use of alternative medicine in the treatment of hepatitis C.
side effects.summary: Silymarin has a good safety record with only rare case reports of gastrointestinal disturbances and allergic skin rashes.

side effects.title: New Therapeutic Potentials of Milk Thistle (Silybum marianum)
side effects.summary: Silymarin has side effects similar to placebo and is safe for therapeutic use, with potential applications in various cancers, neurological, nephro-, and cardio-protective effects, and fetoprotective and prolactin effects.

side effects.title: [Milk Thistle (Silybum Marianum) as a Supportive Phytotherapeutic Agent in Oncology].
side effects.summary: Milk thistle (silymarin) has mainly beneficial effects in hepatotoxicity and radiotherapy-induced skin and mucosa damage at dosages of 160-600 mg daily.
side effects.journal: Klinicka onkologie : casopis Ceske a Slovenske onkologicke spolecnosti

side effects.title: Silymarin (Milk Thistle) can revoke liver enzyme changes during chemotherapy of breast cancer with Taxanes
side effects.summary: Silymarin (Milk Thistle) alleviated liver enzyme changes during chemotherapy of breast cancer with taxanes, reducing liver injury.

side effects.title: Effects of long-term silymarin oral supplementation on the blood biochemical profile of rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss)
side effects.summary: Oral administration of silymarin up to 400 mg per 1 kg of food has no side effect on blood biochemical and clinical parameters of fishes.

side effects.title: A randomized controlled trial to assess the safety and efficacy of silymarin on symptoms, signs and biomarkers of acute hepatitis.
side effects.summary: Silymarin is well tolerated and improves symptoms of acute clinical hepatitis, including dark urine, jaundice, and scleral icterus.
side effects.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

side effects.title: Silymarin alleviates bleomycin-induced pulmonary toxicity and lipid peroxidation in mice
side effects.summary: Silymarin attenuated bleomycin-induced pulmonary toxicity by maintaining oxidant-antioxidant balance and regulating inflammatory mediator release.

dosage.title: Pharmacokinetics and Metabolic Profile of Free, Conjugated, and Total Silymarin Flavonolignans in Human Plasma after Oral Administration of Milk Thistle Extract
dosage.summary: Oral administration of 600 mg of standardized milk thistle extracts led to rapid elimination of silymarin flavonolignans with short half-lives.

dosage.title: Safety and toxicity of silymarin, the major constituent of milk thistle extract: An updated review
dosage.summary: Silymarin is well tolerated at doses up to 700 mg three times a day for 24 weeks, with some gastrointestinal discomforts like nausea and diarrhea.

dosage.title: Effect of Milk Thistle on the Pharmacokinetics of Darunavir-Ritonavir in HIV-Infected Patients
dosage.summary: Silymarin dosage in this study was 150 mg every 8 hours.

dosage.title: Formulation Strategies for Enhancing the Bioavailability of Silymarin: The State of the Art
dosage.summary: Silymarin is safe at high doses (>1500 mg/day) in humans, but its bioavailability and intestinal absorption can be improved using nanotechnological strategies.

dosage.title: Silymarin Ascending Multiple Oral Dosing Phase I Study in Noncirrhotic Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C
dosage.summary: Oral doses of silymarin up to 2.1 g per day were safe and well tolerated in noncirrhotic HCV patients.

dosage.title: [Milk Thistle (Silybum Marianum) as a Supportive Phytotherapeutic Agent in Oncology].
dosage.summary: Milk thistle (silymarin) has mainly beneficial effects in hepatotoxicity and radiotherapy-induced skin and mucosa damage at dosages of 160-600 mg daily.
dosage.journal: Klinicka onkologie : casopis Ceske a Slovenske onkologicke spolecnosti

dosage.title: Antiosteoclastic Activity of Milk Thistle Extract after Ovariectomy to Suppress Estrogen Deficiency-Induced Osteoporosis
dosage.summary: Oral dosage of 10 mg/kg milk thistle extract (MTE) containing silibinin is effective in preventing estrogen deficiency-induced bone loss.

dosage.title: Silymarin therapy and improvement of cardiac outcome in patients with β-thalassemia major
dosage.summary: Silymarin at a daily dosage of 60 mg/kg orally has shown cardioprotective effects in iron overload conditions.
dosage.journal: Journal of Research in Pharmacy Practice

dosage.title: A randomized controlled trial to assess the safety and efficacy of silymarin on symptoms, signs and biomarkers of acute hepatitis.
dosage.summary: A standard recommended dose of 140 mg of silymarin three times daily for four weeks was found to be safe and effective in improving symptoms of acute clinical hepatitis.
dosage.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

dosage.title: Role of the 5-HT1A Serotonergic System in Anxiolytic-Like Effects of Silymarin
dosage.summary: Oral administrations of silymarin (35, 70, 140, and 280 mg per rat) for 2 weeks induced an anxiolytic-like effect in rats.
